author: Special Correspondent
text:
In a gruesome incident, four members of a family, including a young mother, her one-and-a-half-year-old child and a Plus Two student, were electrocuted at their house at Thavatharendal in Tirupuvanam taluk of the district on Friday evening.

Police said that A. Lakshmi (26), carrying her child Priyadarshini, inserted the electric plug to operate the grinder with a wet hand when she suffered an electric shock.

Hearing the noise, V. Puyal (56), her father-in-law, who was in the house, went to her rescue and he also suffered an electric shock.

As they were struggling, Meena (17), daughter of Puyal, went to their rescue and all of them were electrocuted in a few seconds, the police said.

Murugayee (52), wife of Puyal, who was sitting outside the house rushed in and shouted for help when a teen-aged boy from the adjacent house removed the plug.

Unhurt

He also suffered electric shock but escaped unhurt, the police said.

Lakshmi was wife of Azhagu, one of Puyal’s five sons. Puyal’s only daughter Meena was studying Plus Two in Tirupuvanam Government Higher Secondary School and appearing for the final examinations, the police added.

Case registered

The police registered a case and removed the bodies to Government Rajaji Hospital in Madurai for post-mortem.

Superintendent of Police Ziaul Haque visited the spot and conducted preliminary enquiry.
title: Four persons of family electrocuted
